doc_class_description: A Court of Appeal judgment is a higher court ruling that reviews decisions of lower courts, shaping legal precedent and protecting citizens’ rights.

latest_doc_d.description: Ginimella Hewage Priyanga Nishantha Kumar Vs. M. A. P. Jayakody, Western Province Co-operative Development Commissioner/Registrar and 12 Others before Hon. Mahen Gopallawa J.
latest_doc_d.parties: Ginimella Hewage Priyanga Nishantha Kumar Vs. M. A. P. Jayakody, Western Province Co-operative Development Commissioner/Registrar and 12 Others
latest_doc_d.keywords: co-operative society, dispute, arbitration, arbitral award, appeal, Magistrates’ Court, judicial review, scope, misrepresentation and suppression of material facts, uberrima fides, alternative remedies, laches, reliefs misconceived in law, material and necessary parties
latest_doc_d.legistation: Writ – Certiorari-Mandamus-dispute between Petitioner and Co-operative Society-arbitration under Western Province Co-operative Societies Statute-arbitral awards illegal and irrational-institution of proceedings in the Magistrates’ Court
